intro: Hieracium froelichianum subsp. vesinense, commonly known as the Vesine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, often found in moist meadows and grasslands. The plant produces yellow flower heads composed of numerous small florets, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. It is native to Central and Eastern Europe and is considered a rare and endemic species in certain regions.
